commit_list.message:
Recent changes in the Omni frameworks:

General:
  - Fixed complaints/warnings from clang-sa 254.

OmniBase/OmniFoundation:
  - Add backtrace buffer types for the exception handlers in OFController,
    so that we can get nicely formatted+symbolicated traces for them in OCC.

OmniAppKit:
  - Added -[NSScrollView(OAExtensions) positionOfDividerAtIndex]
  - Fixed name of OATextAttachment's cell property to be attachmentCell like
    in AppKit.
  - Made ivars on OAPreferenceClient private and added accessors.

OmniQuartz:
  - Deprecated -[CALayer(OQExtensions) isPresentationLayer] since it was
    wasteful and we've stopped using it for now.

OmniSQLite:
  - Added/updated some API to use NSError.
  - Added support for retrying operations.

OmniUI/iPad:
  - Added OUIActionInspectorSlice for inspectors slices that have a well
    button that invokes an action.
  - Also, added OUIDetailInspectorSlice, a subclass of OUIActionInspectorSlice
    where the action is to push an inspector sub-pane. The inspector pane is
    lazily created via a block passed in at init time currently.
  - Added OUITextColorInspectorWell, OUITextColorsInspectorSlice, and
    OUITextSpanColorAttributeInspectorSlice to show both foreground and
    background text colors, and to pushs a sub-inspector to edit them when
    tapped. OUIEditableFrame doesn't currently draw background colors on text
    runs (CoreText doesn't even have an attribute for this, so we'll need to
    add it).
  - Updated OUIColorInspectorPane to automatically pick the best color pane
    for the selection.
  - Updated some view controllers that host sub-view controllers to pass along
    view{Will,Did}{Appear,Disappear}:.
  - Updated OUIInspectorDividerLine for the new light themes inspectors.
  - OUIInspectorSegmentedControl now has a allowsEmptySelection property.
  - Added (placeholder) images for paragraph alignments in
    OUIParagraphStyleInspectorSlice. Set the alignment segmented control to
    allow empty selection. In this state, we use OANaturalTextAlignment.
  - Pulled in drag gesture recognizer updates from apps and a proof of concept
    rotation recognizer.

commit_list.message:
Turn off -mdynamic-no-pic for iOS.

Testing the launch time of OO/iPad on the device (under 4.2), I don't see any
huge difference <https://devforums.apple.com/message/366445#366445>

Added OUIElapsedTimeSinceProcessCreation(), which does the sysctl() goop
to get the process creation time and compare it to the current time.
If you call this at the top of main() you can get some sort of measure of the
time spent in the kernel, dyld, constructors, ObjC initialization, etc.

See https://github.com/omnigroup/OmniGroup/issues#issue/9

commit_list.message:
Bulk update of recent changes in our frameworks.

Highlights:

Overall:
  - tops replace 'isa' with '[self class]', catching a bunch of old code we hadn't fixed manually
  - Updated project script phases to deal with changes to BuildStringsFromTarget
  - Removed a few stale use of SPI or since-deprecated API that gets rejected in Mac App Store submissions.
  - Added explicit NS_RETURNS_RETAINED annotations in 'copy' methods where copy isn't at the front of the method name (for clang 2.0).
  - Updated BuildStringsFromTarget to work for Mac targets, catch more errors, and obey string encoding preferences passed from Xcode.
  - Updated CopyLibraryResources to obey string encoding settings passed from Xcode.

OmniBase:
  - Expose OB_BUILTIN_ATOMICS_AVAILABLE and reenable on iOS since compiler emits valid atomic ops for ARM.
  - Treat code living in /Library the same as /System/Library so we don't warn about third-party frameworks.
  - Added (Debug-only) OBPatchTrap.[hm]. This includes a routine to find the code in objc_msgSend_stret() for a nil receiver and patches it to log/raise/etc like so:
		2010-11-16 18:56:43.714 OmniPlan[42103:a0f] -[NSScrollView setDocumentView:] (0x7fff8006b104, in AppKit) sent -bounds to nil, expecting struct return
  - Added more runtime KVO sanity checking; warn when there is a +keyPathsForValuesAffectingFoo but no -foo property.

OmniFoundation:
	- Updated the OFDataBuffer and compression API to improve performance (avoid copies, stdio, and optionally GC scans of resulting data).
  - New function OFStringContainsInvalidSequences() which checks for completely-bogus UTF-16 contents.
  - Add support for *.defaults resources. If found, register them just like defaults in bundle Info.plists/OFRegistrations. This allows us to split our shared defaults out of framework Info.plists and use the *.defaults files on both platforms.
  - Add convenience wrapper for CFPropertyList {de,}serialization, hiding the API difference between Mac OS X 10.6/iOS 4.x and iOS 3.x.
  - Split out NSData hash support and include that on the iOS side.

OmniUI/General:
  - New flatter toolbar button look, still a work in progress too.
  - Split out OUIParameters.h to expose knobs to our UI folks for tuning.
  - Added app-global system for managing the current popover to help avoid multiple-popover-avoidance code bloat (something similar really should be built-into UIKit).
  - Added OUICertificateTrustAlert and use it in the WebDAV integration.
  - Some cleanup in document system of previews, UTI helpers and document lifecycle.
  - Support for hiding the toolbar in OUIToolbarViewController.
  - Fixed keyboard avoidance for toggling between multiple keyboards changing the keyboard height.
  - Added helper functions for updating table view rows for selection changes.
  - Added OUIWithAppropriateLayerAnimations(^{...}) for passing UIKit animation down to CA in UIView setters that poke the layer's animated properties.

OmniUI/Inspectors:
	- New lighter look for inspector controls. Not shipped yet in any of our apps, so there are likely rough edges still.
	- Simplified and better sub-inspector model. Now sub-panes can override the selected object set.
	- Single-color swatch picker support for inspectors (like in OmniGraffle).
	- Clean up font inspector to be a bit more iWork-y (sans some of iWork's bugs).
	- Deprecated old inspector delegate methods, replacing with a version that passes the pane that is asking.
	- Fix bug that prevented inspector from being closed in some cases.
  - Switch OUIInspectorTextWell to use OUIEditableFrame for editing to avoid jumpy transition.
  - Add support for left-label/right-value mode in OUIInspectorTextWell.
  - Following iWork's lead, hide inspectors on undo/redo rather than trying to keep them up to date. Sometimes this is impossible anyway if the undo deletes the inspected object!

OmniUI/Text system:
  - Fixed issues with autocorrection and ideographic input due to unclear UITextInput documentation.
  - Minimal support for attachments in rich text. No built-in attachment classes yet, but the TextEditor example has a sample image cell.
  - Layout fixes for scaled text.
  - Avoid crashes due to UIKit passing nils to UITextInput methods.
  - Allow toggling on inspector support (for the selected text range).
  - Better support for right/center aligned text.

OmniUI/TextEditor sample:
  - Added toolbar item and supporting code to demo/debug text attachments.

OmniAppKit:
  - Add placeholder support for NSTextAttachment and NSTextAttachmentCell standins for iOS.
  - Fixed some issues with modal windows and OATargetSelection.
  - Some cleanup of the 64-bit-ization of the NSBezierPath extensions.
  - Fix bug with clicking in the last week of the year in OACalendarView giving us week 0 of the following year.

OmniFileStore:
  - Add delegate hooks and support for certificate warnings.

OmniQuartz:
  - Deprecate -[OQContentAnimatingLayer hasContentAnimations] with a note about why.
  - Add support for proper scaled rendering of UIImages.

OmniSoftwareUpdate:
  - Improved reporting of OSStatus-based errors via the new OFOSStatusDescription().

commit_list.message:
Bulk update of recent changes in our frameworks for iOS 4.2 and other updates.

Highlights:

Configurations:
  - Switch from llvm-gcc-4.2 to clang for both iOS and Mac.
  - Twiddle our debug information to have what we need for local symbolication
  - Link against the latest iphoneos, but target 3.2 as the minimum.

Overall:
  - Fixed new warnings reported by clang top-of-tree.
  - Run genstrings at build time in various places.
  - Various iOS 4.2 updates.
  - Optimized images.

OmniBase:
  - Adding some inttypes-style format macros for Apple-defined types
  - Catch common error of key-specific variant of
    +automaticallyNotifiesObserversForKey: using ...ForFoo instead of
    ...OfFoo.

OmniFoundation:
  - Extensions and clean up of NSUndoManager debugging extension.
  - Added a copy of Apple's NetReachability so we could avoid adding it in
    multiple apps.

OmniFileStore:
  - Brought over HTTP redirection fixes from OmniFocus/1.x
  - Added an iOS target.
  - Added options for directory enumeration
  - Report the last modification date in OFSFileInfo entries.
  - Cleaned up API for asynchronous operations to be more consistent with
    synchronous.
    - Async methods always return a non-nil operation on success.
    - Async operations have a protocol declared, including a startup method
      (so you can store them in an ivar w/o worrying about a race with
      completion).
  - Added async write operations with support for tracking progress.
  - Updated the 'ofs' command line tool with a new 'acp' command to test async
    read/write and progress.

OmniAppKit:
  - Various binding fixes for OAPopupDatePicker.
  - Fixed issues with OAFontDescriptor's lookup of symbolic traits;
    consistently fall back to the internal CTFontRef's values if the attribute
    dictionary doesn't specify a value.
  - Add more {NS,CT} text attribute mappings in OATextAttributes.[hm].
  - Fixed some OATargetSelection behavior with sheets.
  - OAScriptToolbarHelper retains its toolbar item for the duration of the
    script to avoid a zombie if the script closes the containing window.

OmniQuartz:
  - Fix OQLayerRemovalAnimation to call the completion handler if we're not
    animating.
  - Fixed some glitches with OQHoleLayer.
  - Be more careful about colorspace conversions in OQColor. Sure wish iOS had
    a linear RGB colorspace.

OmniInspector:
  - Some cleanup for single-inspector configurations

OmniSoftwareUpdate:
  - Turned on signature checking.
  - Added an iOS target that just sends OS/hardware info (just the analytics
    part), along with hooks for integrating into apps.
    - This isn't enabled in any of our apps yet since we don't have UI for it
      we like yet.
  - Do the checks in the main executable; the OmniSoftwareUpdateCheck tool
    still exists for debugging, but we can't use it on iOS so the framework no
    longer uses it.
  - Fixed some leaks now that we do OSU checks in the main process instead of
    letting them die with the background tool.
  - Use OFNetReachability instead of having our own reachability code.

OmniUnzip:
  - Implemented a convenience method +createZipFile:fromFiles:error:, for
  	easily zipping up any number of files or directories into a single
  	.zip wrapper.  (Handy for attaching to an email message or uploading
  	to a WebDAV server.)

OmniUI:
  - Added WebDAV-based import/export support for documents.
  - Added iWork-like export sheet.
  - Fixes/extensions to OUIUndoBarButtonItem to help avoid multiple popovers.
  - Added an optional scrubber on the document picker to quickly navigate
    the list of documents.
  - Add support for sorting documents by name or modification date.
  - Added OUIAnimationSequence for running a sequence of block-based
    animations.
  - Added OUIWithoutAnimating(), taking an animation block and running it with
    +[UIView areAnimationsEnabled] set to NO.
  - Add hooks for printing.
  - Add initial pass at OmniSoftwareUpdate analytics support. Disabled for now
    until we decide we decide on good UI (or fail to do so).
  - Added debugging checks that calls to -convert{Point,Rect}:{to,from}View:
    are not made with views without a common ancestor.
  - Text selection tweaks:
	  - Changed the color of the highlight and carets.
    - Replaced the drawn knob with a .png.
    - Round off the translation portion of the loupe zoom transform to reduce
      crawl.
		- Positioning the rectangular loupe based on the text selection's
		  endpoint's location, rather than the location of the touch.
  - Update font inspector to work more like iWork. Strikethrough support is
    optional since we haven't yet implemented it in our text rendering.
  - Add support for underline-by-word as a render-time transform.

[r138058] <bug://bugs/63479> (Zoom overlay should be positioned relative to user's fingers, rather than in the center of the screen)

Normally, the zoom HUD shows up a ways out from the center of the two touches that are zooming.  But joelr noticed a special case in iWork where the zoom HUD is directly between the two fingers if they are roughly vertical.  That makes sense because at that angle it's hard to guess where the main part of the user's hand is.  Easy fix, with a made-up constant (20-pixel allowable horizontal offset).

commit_list.message:
[r137225] Make text stick to the top of OUIEditableFrame instead of the bottom.

In field editors, if the height of the editor is taller than the text (perhaps it needs to span a minimum height), the text needs to stick to the origin like in NSTextView and friends.

There are still remaining issues (as there were before) the transition between using OUIEditableFrame and OUITextLayout with multiple lines. Something about how we are (or aren't) positioning/pixel-snapping in the two cases differs, causing jumpiness in the apparent text origin and jumpiness in line spacing as new lines are added. Wim will likely need to look at what is going on here.

OUITextLayout:
- Factored out a couple new functions, OUITextLayoutOrigin() and OUITextLayoutDrawFrame() and use them in both the OUITextLayout and OUIEditableFrame drawing paths.
- OUITextLayoutOrigin() calculates the layout origin like OUIEditableFrame used to, except that it pins the text to the top.
- OUITextLayoutDrawFrame() takes the bounds to draw in and the layout origin to use and does what OUIEditableFrame used to, but now OUITextLayout can use it.

OUIEditableFrame:
- Use the new functions in OUITextLayout to get the layout origin (pinning the text to the top now) and draw.
- Set our content mode to UIViewContentModeTopLeft so that when animating resizing we don't stretch our text.

OmniUI's TextEditor example:
- Adjust the layout of the view such that the editable text takes up the full width of the scroll view and at least its height, but possible more if the text needs it.
- Fix the effective page text width to something like 8 1/2 inches.
- Zooming likely needs work, if it works at all.

commit_list.message:
[r138084] Improve inspector resizing support

The inspector window wasn't resizing as needed when the column type was changed. This is due to the general inspector rearrangement in OO4, which revealed that there wasn't a mechanism in place to prompt parent inspectors from laying out again to accommodate size changes in descendant inspectors.

Added a new method, -inspectorDidResize:, on both OIInspector and OIInspectorController. When an inspector (in this case, the column type inspector) changes its size programmatically, it informs its inspector controller via -inspectorDidResize:. The controller simply passes the message on to the root inspector (if that is not the same as the one that resized).

OIInspector's implementation of -inspectorDidResize: doesn't do anything except assert that it never gets called (because this method shouldn't be called on the inspector that initiated the notification). OISectionedInspector and OITabbedInspector notify any appropriate child inspectors, and then relayout to accommodate the size changes.

Modified -setInspectorController: on OITabbedInspector and OISectionedInspector to also set the inspector controller on any tabs/sections, so that they know the inspector controller and can notify it of height changes.

Modified -[OOColumnTypeInspector _redisplay] to call -[OIInspectorController inspectorDidResize:] instead of calling -updateExpandedness:, which doesn't have the context that we have available to us. Also, modified it to assume (and assert) that the inspector view is inside a flipped view, since it now is, with the inspector rearrangement. And be more defensive about asking for the controlsView frame, since the analyzer doesn't like us calling a struct-returning method on an object that could be nil.

commit_list.message:
[r136540] Factored out the drag-hysteresis tracking into a new gesture recognizer subclass, OUILongPressGestureRecognizer.

Just add an "O" to the beginning of your gesture recognizer class name, and you get hysteresis tracking for free.  There is also a method -resetHysteresis which causes the tracking to start over from the current location of the finger(s).  This is useful for nudging -- if the first finger is slowly drifting while the user performs a nudge swipe with a second finger, we don't want that first finger's movement to interfere with the precise nudging (so we reset the hysteresis with every nudge).  I converted some of the GesturePlayground classes to use this new abstracted hysteresis tracking.

This basically completes the functionality of the built-in UILongPressGestureRecognizer when used for dragging/resizing/panning.  In case I haven't said this before, there are a lot of reasons to use LongPress GRs instead of Pan GRs -- even when you don't care about using the built-in delay.  One reason is that they will always "recognize" before the UIScrollView's Pan GR kicks in.  Another reason is that a LongPress GR with a delay of about 0.02 seconds leaves enough time for a second finger to hit the screen, cleanly allowing two-finger gestures to occur.

(The default UILongPressGestureRecognizer does in fact utilize hysteresis behind the scenes, but it only takes effect before the delay timer finishes.  i.e. if your finger doesn't move more than 10 pixels before the timer fires, it's considered a long press.  But any movement *after* that causes a "changed" event regardless.  The hysteresis tracking I added gives us a way to ask whether the finger has really moved far enough to start performing whatever action the GR is supposed to do.  if (![gestureRecognizer overcameHysteresis]) return;  )

commit_list.message:
[r134851, r134856, r134857] WIP on tappable links in text.

OUITextLayout:
- Added a utility function, OUICreateTransformedAttributedString, that takes a source attributed string and link attributes. If the source has a link and there are link attributes to use, it returns new immutable attributed string with the link attributes added to the link ranges. Otherwise, it returns nil, letting the caller know that it did nothing (as opposed to returning [source copy] which might be pointer != if the input is mutable).
- Added +defaultLinkTextAttributes, returning blue/underline.
- Note OUITextLayout does *not* currently apply link attributes to the text given to it. We might want to start doing that, though we'd want a way to turn it off.

OUIEditableFrame:
- Added a linkAttributes property, defaulting to +[OUITextLayout defaultLinkTextAttributes].
- When building our immutableContent for handing off to CoreText, we try passing it through OUICreateTransformedAttributedString(). If this results in a transformed string, we record this fact in a new flag, immutableContentHasAttributeTransforms.
- In -attributedText, only return the substring of the immutableContent if it isn't transformed.

Make the attribute/getter setter take a vanilla UITextRange instead of publisizing what should be a private class.

OUITextLayout now remembers the attributed string it was given.
Also, make its init method take an NSAttributedString instead of CFAttributedStringRef (since all the callers were casting anyway).

commit_list.message:
[r133308] Working on <bug://bugs/58059> (Inspector revamp)

OIInspectorRegistry populates the inspection set by walking the responder chain and any delegates and asking any appropriate objects to add any inspected objects to the inspection set.

This change relinquishes the responder-chain walking to OAApplication's applyToResponderChain block handler, but continues to explicitly check the delegates of each responder, because normal responder chain target searches does not include all delegates. Since applyToResponderChain does hit most delegates, some will get examined twice, but the existing code was already having to guard against asking the same object multiple times for its inspected objects (via the seenControllers set), so we won't be adding inspected objects twice for any target or delegate.

The block that is applied to the responder chain performs the same action for both the target object and the target object's delegate, so that code is factored out into a block of its own, and separately applied to the target and the target's delegate (if the target has a delegate).

r:tjw

commit_list.message: [r133360] OmniInspector's auto-tab-selection architecture relies on the selected objects being added in most-specific to least-specific order, but its own code for gathering up all the selected objects did the opposite, by asking next responders (and their delegates) to add their selected objects to the inspection set before asking the first responder. This didn't seem to bother OmniFocus, but it was preventing the auto-tab-selection from working correctly for OmniOutliner, so it now asks the current responder first, then its delegate, before recursing for the next responder.

commit_list.message:
[r133345] Moved the OFInternalAPI category implementation to the bottom of the file.
Merged the Private category into the main class as a class extension.
Renamed a few private methods to have leading underscores like the rest of them.

[r133348] shigeyas (on github) noticed that a bunch of our tests fail if you are running with a locale of ja_JP.

The only way I could find to reproduce this (short of setting my system locale) was:

	defaults write "otest-x86_64" AppleLocale en_US
	defaults write "otest-i386" AppleLocale en_US

Having done this, these changes now "fix" this problem by:

  - Forcing en_US in the unit tests
  - Remove OFRelativeDateParser's currentCalendar ivar, implicit setting thereof and possibly zombies.
  - Update OFRelativeDateParser to take an NSCalendar instead of a timeZone and calendarIdentifier.
  - Update OFRelativeDateParser to apply its calendar and that calendar's locale to any NSDateFormatter it creates.

OFRelativeDateParser defaults to gregorian/local tz/current locale in a couple places if you pass a nil calendar.

As an aside, we now assert that NSDateFormatter instances start out with NSDateFormatterBehavior10_4 instead of setting it (since we are linked on 10.6).

commit_list.message:
[r133308] Moved architecture from OmniFocus to OmniInspector for auto-selection of inspector tabs, so that OmniOutliner can share this code.

- OIInspector gets "-shouldBeUsedForObject:", taken from TabbedInspector.

- OIInspector gets "-shouldBeUsedForObjectPredicate", taken from SectionedInspector.

- OITabbedInspector gets "-_selectTabBasedOnObjects:", taken from TabbedInspector, and modified to not refer to SectionedInspector, as the necessary API is now on OIInspector.

- OITabbedInspector now has a flag for whether or not tabs should be auto-selected. This flag is read from the inspector dictionary via the "auto-selection" key, but defaults to the same value as the "single-selection" flag, so by default single-selection also means auto-selection but that can be overriden if desired.

- OITabbedInspector's "-inspectObjects:" now calls "[self _selectTabBasedOnObjects:]", as TabbedInspector used to do, but only if auto-selection of tabs is enabled, and if there aren't any pinned tabs (pinned tabs should not be moved away from automatically - more changes coming separately to allow pinning tabs when in single-selection mode).

- TabbedInspector was left with nothing to do, so was removed and the Inspectors.plist modified to reference OITabbedInspector instead.

[r133136] Make OQContentAnimatingLayer use the 10.6 + iPhone 3.0 CALayer method, +needsDisplayForKey:.
Remove our timer for driving animations, but left most of the rest of OQContentAnimatingLayer's convenience helpers.

Updated the existing subclasses to work with this new approach. The extra bit needed is that since we are going through the real CA animation path, our copy of our layer gets made for the presenattion loop via -initLayer:. We need to subclass this to copy the state that'll be used in the drawing method.

[r133145] Add a note about needing to implement -initWithLayer: in some cases.

[r133202] Added OQContentAnimatingLayer to the iPad project.

commit_list.message:
Improved resource merging for static library frameworks

- Updated ListSourceFilesInTarget to check for PBXReferenceProxy instances when searching for files and to deal with BUILT_PRODUCTS_DIR-relative files.
- Updated BuildStringsFromTarget and explicity static-library-framework Copy Resource phases to emit resources to .../Resources/$PRODUCT_NAME instead of using $TARGET_NAME ("OmniFoundation" instead of "OmniFoundationTouch", for example).
- Updated CopyLibraryResources to use ListSourceFilesInTarget to find all the .a files in the target and merge resources from those static-library-frameworks.
- Updated all the invocations of CopyLibraryResources to not pass an explicit list of targets to merge from.

commit_list.message:
Turned off a bunch of Xcode's aggressive headermap options for our iPhoneOS static library targets.
This makes it a little harder to have an import <Foo/bar.h> without having to make bar.h a public header (and while doing that, add bar.m to the project). Often the linker will help with this, but it won't for category methods. This doesn't solve all cases of the problem, but some at least.

Made a bunch of headers public in the frameworks that should have already been.

commit_list.message:
This update brings a bunch of iPad support that we've developed for our applications, as well as various extensions and fixes for the Mac. The existing iPhone/iPad code has been wrapped up into static library targets for easier use (of course, only a subset of the code has been ported to iPhone OS, as needed).

Details follow:

OmniUI/iPad:
  - First release of this framework!
  - Includes a bunch of features from our iPad apps
    - Document picker, basic document-based application support
    - CoreText-based text editor (still a work in progress, but a great start)
      - We'll be working more on performance for large blobs of text, which we haven't needed yet.
    - Zooming/tiling scroll view system
    - Extensible inspector system; includes full font and color inspectors (palette, hsv, rgb, gray)
    - widgets (thumb wheel, color swatches, toggle buttons, matching segmented control, editable text well)
  - Support for sending feedback, exporting documents/PDF via Mail, documentation, etc.
  - See examples in OmniGroup/Frameworks/OmniUI/iPad/Examples
    - The text editor example is still in progress, but isn't fully hooked up yet (no inspectors yet)
  - Gesture recognizer debugging helper (logs all events and state changes)
  - "Direct" tap recognizer subclass
  - Overlay hint view (for example, showing the % zoom level while in the middle of a zoom gesture).
  - Basic RTF reading/writing

OmniQuartz:
  - First release of this framework!
  - Includes a subset as a static library OmniQuartzTouch target for iPhone OS.
  - Includes lots of CALayer debugging support, helpers (log all animations, logging of layer trees, vector output for layer trees)
  - Includes some basic drawing routings for
  - Includes some simple CoreImage utilities
  - Includes a class cluster of color component preserving color classes. UIColor is more "build-only". OQColor remembers the components you gave it and acts more like a model object (including XML and plist archiving support based on NSColor(OAExtensions)).
  - Includes delayed layer removal animations (since removing a layer normally is instantaneous in CA unless you want default animation).
  - Includes a (perspective correct) view transition flip animation
  - Includes a 'hole' layer.

Configurations:
  - Consolidated some Mac and iPhone settings such that the Omni-Global-* files are shared between platforms.
  - Added Target-{Mac,Touch}-* configurations for target-specific options
  - Added support for static libraries on the iPhone, that act somewhat like frameworks

General:
  - Various clang + llvm 2.7 static warnings and static analyzer fixes
  - Made various bits of constant data be marked 'const' (notification names, dictionary keys, etc)
  - More work on GC support. Still not there.
  - Switched from NS geometry types to CG types in many places. -DNS_BUILD_32_LIKE_64 is your friend.
  - Rearranged/refactored extensions into separate files to allow porting smaller relevant chunks to iPhone OS

Scripts:
  - Added a script to export a strings file based on the files that were compiled into a static library. It's a hack.
  - Added a script that can be run from an iPad app to merge resources exported by the static library projects. See the "Copy Library Resources" script phase in OmniGroup/Frameworks/OmniUI/iPad/Examples/TextEditor for an example.

FixStringsFile:
  - Added this little tool we use to sort and do basic ASCII->Unicode substitution on strings files ("..." becomes an ellipsis, for example).

OmniBase:
  - Added OmniBaseTouch static library target for iPhone/iPad
  - Removed OBError/OBErrorWithInfo macros. These weren't suitable for iPad development where OMNI_BUNDLE_IDENTIFIER might be the main bundle. Each framework domain should define its own macros and own domain global NSString key.
  - Added OBLoadBundle tool. This is is useful to run the OmniBase ABI consistency checks on arbitrary frameworks/bundles.
  - Added OBAssertThrows, which is just like STAssertThrows but doesn't provoke a clang-sa warning.
  - Added scanned memory allocation wrapper macros that do a reasonable job of working when GC is enabled or not.
  - Make OMNI_BUNDLE work on iPad (just trivially the main bundle in that case).
  - Added OBFinishPortingLater(). This will warn once when hit.
  - Added _OBIsNegative helpers and OBASSERT_NONNEGATIVE macro. This is useful for avoiding clang warnings about comparing unsigned vs. zero.
  - Define the NS_RETURNS_RETAINED clang-sa helper macro, if it isn't defined already since iPhone OS 3.2 doesn't define this.
  - Turn off RCS_ID strings on iPhone. No one is going to run ident on the executable and the executable size matters more here.

OmniFoundation:
  - Added OmniFoundationTouch with the common set of classes/extensions our apps need. You might want to tweak it for your own use.
  - Disable libbz2 compression support on iPhone OS. libbz2 is present, but the headers aren't and Apple considers this private API.
  - Split out a OFEnumNameTable(OFXMLArchiving) category in separate files. Nice if you don't want any of the XML support in your library.
	- Added -[OFMultiValueDictionary parametersFromQueryString] for parsing URL query strings.
	- OFFilterProcess uses POSIX spawn() if possible. Also fixed some GC issues.
  - Added OFNetChangeNotifier.
  - Added -[OFPreference coerceStringValue:toTypeOfPropertyListValue] -- used in the preference setting URL support in our iPhone OS apps
  - Added OFSaveType; a mirror of NSSaveOperation, but available on iPad.
  - Added more block-based helpers on NSArray, -indexByBlock, -firstInRange:that:, -last:, -lastInRange:that:
  - Added ICS-formatted NSDate/NSString conversion methods in NSDate(OFExtensions).
  - Added block-based -[NSString(OFExtensions) strinByPerformingReplacement:onCharacters:options:range:].
  - Added OFASN1DescribeOID()

OmniFoundation/OmniAppKit:
  - Added some stand-in classes or stubs for AppKit classes. More refinement to come.

	  OFFileWrapper
    OAFontDescriptor
    OAParagraphStyle
    OAMutableParagraphStyle
    OATextTab

  - New OmniAppKitTouch target with just these stand-ins.
  - New OAStepperTextField control.
  - Removed deprecated support for document backups using resource forks.
  - Removed support for fixing up HFS attributes on written file wrappers. This bug has been fixed in the system frameworks for a while.
  - Added -[NSView(OAExtensions) enclosingViewOfClass:]
  - Various tweaks to rendering in OACalendarView

OmniUnzip:
  - Added an OmniUnzipTouch target

OmniSoftwareUpdate:
  - Support for opting in/out of update tracks.
  - Various UI fixes and cleanup
  - More work on signed feeds
  - Set quarantine on installed apps (until we verify their signature)
  - Fixes on the install path
  - Added utilities for generating feeds

commit_list.message:
Updated and added public frameworks from Omni's current svn trunk.

Highlights include the following...

New code:
  - Added OmniUnzip, an ObjC wrapper for reading and writing zip files, based on 'minizip'.
  - Added OmniFileStore, which provides a NSFileManager-like interface, but using NSURLs, to find/read/write files across the local filesystem or WebDAV.

Configurations and Scripts:
  - Require 10.6
  - Use @rpath instead of @executable_path
  - Build with gcc 4.2 and the clang static analyzer (top-of-tree is much improved and we build with that too if you want to edit the configs)
  - Enabled 64->32 implicit conversion warnings. This catches lots of crufty code at the expense of some spurious warnings.
  - Added our workaround for an Xcode misfeature where unit test don't get run for release builds.

General:
  - Lots of 64-bit cleanup.
    - In some cases, we've just #if'd out code and replaced it with OBFinishPorting (which raises when we hit it).
    - Much of OWF and OIF, for example, are slated to be trimmed out since we no longer use them.
  - Removed lots of pre-10.6 code and switched to 10.6 variants where applicable. More left to be done.
  - Removed other code that we weren't using any more (instead of porting it w/o a real world test).
  - Various leak and bug fixes found via top-of-tree clang
  - Some work towards GC support.

OmniBase:
  - Extended and improved our runtime signature verification. This does things like ensure you didn't impelement a protocol and return a 32-bit type when you should have returned a 64-bit type, etc.
  - Factored C core API out of some code to better allow inclusion of only C files in system bundles (to avoid possibility of namespace conflicts)

OmniFoundation:
  - Factored C core API out of some code to better allow inclusion of only C files in system bundles (to avoid possibility of namespace conflicts)
  - Added OFExtent; NSRange but with floats.
  - OFHeap uses blocks now.
  - OFRandom is now a wrapper around "SIMD-oriented Fast Mersenne Twister" from <http://www.math.sci.hiroshima-u.ac.jp/~m-mat/MT/SFMT/index.html>
  - A bunch more work on signed XML support, CDSA wrappers.
  - Add some simple block category methods to containers. More obviously could be done, but we're only adding them as we use them.

OmniFileStore
  - First public release.
  - Vaguely NSFileManager-like API that handles local filesystems and WebDAV.
  - Includes support for https credentials, typically stored in Keychain, via a delegate (since the actual Keychain APIs differ between iPhone and Mac OS X).
  - Support for asynchronous operations (not all implemented).
  - Doesn't do everything, notably, no support for condiional GETs, properties, ETags.
  - Includes a 'ofs' command line tool, mostly for testing.

OmniUnzip:
  - Our ObjC wrapper around the 'minizip' tool.
  - Handles NSFileWrapper <-> zip archive
  - Handles regular, link and directory file types along with basic metadata.
  - Support for moving raw zip members between archives w/o decompressing and recompressing them.

OmniDataObjects:
  - Added support for declaring properties as being calculated. This makes the properties readonly.
  - For one-to-one relationships, require that exactly one side is marked calculated.
  - Added starts-with and contains predicate support for strings.
  - Added support for marking objects as undeletable.
  - Updated delete propagation to issue KVO for to-one relationships of the objects in the deletion set. Also, deleted objects return nil for to-one accessors instead of asserting and crashing.  This allows "foo.bar" key path observations to work (which we didn't use in previous versions).
  - Added some (partial) sanity checking that a predicate used for in-memory vs. SQL qualification will result in the same set of objets matching.
  - Unconditionally support undo, since the iPhone does now.
  - Removed our NSPredicate implementation, now that the iPhone has it (we still have support for building SQL qualifiers, of course).

OmniAppKit:
  - Added our (semi-experimental) OATargetSelection categories for customizing the responder chain and finding target for actions more robustly. YMMV.  See <http://www.cocoatoa.com/posts/2009/12/08/modernizing_the_responder_chain/> for some notes.
  - Some support for block-based NSAlert completion hooks.
  - More support for quarantine property operations via NSFileManager category methods.
  - NOTE: Many of the tests of the bezier extensions are currently failing due to precision changes when building 64-bit. More updates in the future...

OmniSoftwareUpdate:
  - More work on signed feeds
  - Support for compressing common OpenGL extensions into a bitset.
  - Fixes to querying display properties.
  - OpenCL details added to query
  - UI improvements
  - More fixes and bullet-proofing of install process
  - Beginnings of tool to automate appcast feed generation, including signature generation.

commit_list.message:
Batch applied changes up to r118113 from Omni's svn.

The highlights of the changes follow.

Configurations:
	- Switched to dwarf-with-dsym for valgrind
	- Added a series of Library configurations

OmniBase:
	- Fixed clang-sa issues
	- Split up out the C NSError helper functions into their own file for inclusion in Quick Look / Spotlight bundles.
	- Added option to include backtrace where NSErrors are generated (at least with the OB calls)
	- Added/improved runtime checking for common method signature errors:
		- Subclass signature differs from superclass or attached protocol (possible 64-bit issue)
		- Implementing deprecated methods, including support for defining them via protocols including 'Deprecated' in their name.
	- Whitelist some more Cocoa methods.
	- Added support for running code coverage from unit tests, though it uses Omni-internal scripts right now.
	- Added macros for the clang attributes {ns,cf}_returns_retained
	- Added OBBuildByCompilerVersion global CFStringRef
	- Added OB_UNUSED_VALUE macro to help hint to clang that a dead store is OK.
	- Updated assertion macros to cooperate with clang-sa, using the analyzer_noreturn attribute.
	- Added OBASSERT_NULL and OBASSERT_NOTNULL macros to help inform clang-sa of guarantees we make.

OmniFoundation:
	- Fixed clang-sa issues
	- Removed pre-10.5 compatability code
	- Fixed some 64-bit issues
	- Added CF callback helpers for NS{U,}Integer types
	- Added SHA-256 signature support and cleaned up NSData signature generation.
	- Removed some whole classes and various other methods we no longer use (OFBitField, OFOid)
	- A bit of progress on GC support, though more work remains
	- Various other cleanup & modernization in surrounding code
	- Added CDSA helpers for dealing with certificates, signatures and the like
	- Various improvements/cleanup in OFFilterProcess. Switched NSData-filtering methods to use OFFilterProcess
	- Factored OFXMLParser out of OFXMLDocument
	- Added OFXMLReader for a xmlReader-based interface. This avoids reading the entire XML document into DOM-form.
	- Added OFXMLInternedStringTable
	- Added OFXMLMaker/OFXMLTextWriter/OFXMLCFXMLTreeSink
	- Added OFXMLQName for namespace-awareness; started process of updating APIs to use QNames.
	- OFXMLBuffer now stores UTF-8 for simpler libxml interfacing and adds some quoting support.
	- Added OFXMLSignature with a ton of support for ASN.1, X.509 and various other numbers and letters.
	- Fixed bugs and improved performance in XML date reading/writing; added several tests.
	- Added some quarantine/volume extensions to NSFileManager
	- Extend NSUndoManager debug logging support to show disable/enable calls
	- Added/extended many tests.
	- Some updates to OFRandom, but these will be deprecated soon.

OmniSoftwareUpdate:
	- Fixed clang-sa and 64-bit issues
	- Added support for signed software update feeds
	- Added support for signature validation of downloads
	- Improved and simplified user interface for installing updates
	- Improved the installation process to deal with various error cases, quarantine
	- Added support for the user to mark an update as ignored.
	- Various other fixes and cleanup
	- Send the list of GL extensions in the server query in a bitfield, making it vastly smaller.

OmniDataObjects:
	- Fixed clang-sa issues
	- Make -[ODOAttribute isPrimaryKey] public
	- Add configurable support for synchronous writes, temp_store pragmas and vacuum on disconnect
	- Added ODOEditingContextWillSaveNotification
	- Renamed ODOEditingContext{Will,Did}Reset to have a Notification suffix
	- Added -awakeFromUnarchive, though it isn't called by ODO.
	- Added (currently disabled) support for lazy @dynamic method registration.
	- Fixed bug where -setDefaultAttributeValues wasn't issuing KVO.
	- Fixed Ruby->ObjC model generator @class issues and clang-sa issues.

OmniAppKit:
	- Fixed clang-sa issues
	- Removed pre-10.5 compatibility code
	- Make string globals 'NSString * const'.
	- Cleanup display of the user-visible version number in the About panel, dropping display of the svn revision.
	- Fixed bugs in the sheet-queuing support
	- Fixed various other bugs, added various other features

OmniInspector:
	- Fixed clang-sa and 64-bit issues
	- A few other bug fixes and extensions

OmniNetworking:
	- Fixed clang-sa and 64-bit issues

OWF:
	- Fixed clang-sa issue

commit_list.message:
- Switched to build with GCC 4.2
- Enabled NS_BUILD_32_LIKE_64 to make CG/NS structs the same and help improve
  type checking for 64 bit
- Cleaned up a bunch of int/unsigned int types that need to be NSInteger or
  NSUInteger.  More to come.
- Removed OWF's caching support as it is no longer used by OWF or OmniWeb
- Added support in OBPostLoader for finding and warning about classes that add
  object-typed ivars, whose superclass conform to NSCopying, but don't
  themselves implement -copyWithZone:.  These classes often need to implement
  their own -copyWithZone: to either retain, copy or clear the copy's ivars.
  There are false positives, but this is a helpful checklist.
- Added a bunch of missing -copyWithZone: methods.
- Added -cgFloatValue on NSControl and OFNaN, mirroring the version on
  NSNumber and NSString.
- Cleaned up code using fast enumeration, @properties, C99.
- Split guts of OBAssertFailed into OBInvokeAssertionFailureHandler so that
  they can be used independently (OBAssertFailed services as the debugger
  breakpoint target only now).
- Added OBASSERT_NOT_IMPLEMENTED for helping track down stray implementations
  of API that will no longer be called on subclasses or delegates.
- Added support for fetching the committed row count matching a predicate on
  ODODatabase.
- OFBinding how supports key paths throughout for both source and destination
  keys.
- Fixed some date parsing issues in OFRelativeDateParser and added tests
- Fixed buggy hex-formatted string->data conversion and made it use NSError
  instead of raising.
- Added conveniences for accessing XML attributes of various types with
  default values.

commit_list.message:
Batch update to Omni svn r107536; future updates should be more granular...

- Overall updates to avoid APIs deprecated in 10.5 or earlier and remove pre-10.5 support.

- Remove -[NSThread(OFExtensions) inMainThread] and use the 10.5 +isMainThread instead.
- Rename -[NSMutableString(OFExtensions) appendCharacter:] to -appendLongCharacter: since it doesn't take a unichar ("character") but a full 32-bit character.
- Remove OFFile & OFDirectory classes and subclasses.
- Move some horrifying Finder type/creator code from NSFileManager(OFExtensions) to the one place we were using it in OWF.

- Added NSResponder extensions for presenting errors.
- Remove use of the IconFamily library and use recent API in Carbon instead.
- Added -[OAPreferenceController windowIfLoaded] as a performance optimization.
- Remove OAExtendedOutlineView and OAExtendedTableView.

- Added support in OBPostLoader for checking that subclasses or classes conforming to a protocol don't change the type signature of methods.
- Added support in OBPostLoader for checking for usage of deprecated methods via a OBDEPRECATED_METHODS macro.  This is useful in cases where you want to warn implementers of obsolete datasource/delegate methods.

- Improved the performance of the ISO-8601 date/time formatting/parsing signifcantly.
- Fixed an edge case where date times would be incorrectly formatted if the seconds were on the 1000 millisecond boundary.
- In debug builds, catch calls to -[NSProcessInfo hostName] and suggest OFHostName() instead.

- Rearrange and reduce portions of OmniFoundation and OmniBase to minimize dependencies in OmniDataObjects
- Switch to a Ruby DSL for generating the model. This eliminates the OFXML dependency and no ODO apps don't mutate their models.  The startup savings is significant on the iPhone.
- Added a .xodo -> Ruby conversion tool.
- Added a Ruby tool to convert the DSL to ObjC to create the model.
- Removed support for 'decimal' in ODO since it maps to 64-bit float in SQLite.
- Fixed a bug where clearing a to-many fault prior to connecting to SQLite would actually fetch.
- Added some missing binding support for ODOAttributeTypeInt16, ODOAttributeTypeInt64.
- Added ObjC-2 @dynamic property support.  Not currently supporting setting whole to-one relationships; on the assumption that it is easy to set the inverse to-ones.
- Added class<->entity mapping, though I'm not too happy with it yet. See commentary at +[ODOObject resolveInstanceMethod:]
- Tweaked the derived/non-date modifying property registration API
- Added a sample iPhone application that shows how to set up the dependencies to get OmniDataObjects to build in that context.
- Added a bit of support for non-Omni build environments.
- Added some more CoreData/ODO perf comparison tests.

Lots of other small fixes, cleanup and removal of code we aren't using any more.

commit_list.message:
Omni's acumulated changes from LinkBack 1.0.3 to the current date:

- Replaced the old .xcode project with a .xcodeproj and based the framework off Omni's Xcode configurations.
- Modified FindLinkBackServer() to accept an additional parameter, in which an alternate server can be returned.
- Fix up directory resolution order to make sure we get valid paths.
- Use NSSearchPathForDirectoriesInDomains() to identify the Application folders where we will search for the LinkBack server, rather than hard-coding those paths.
- Add optional bundleIdentifier parameter to server methods, so you can specify an identifier to use other than the main bundles id. (part of bug #25588)
- Various fixes to DO invalidation.
- Make this build with -Wshadow (though it exposes a strange cast).
- Use non-deprecated NSFileManager API so this will build on 10.6.
- Fix clang warnings/leaks
- Fix 64->32 implicit cast warnings

commit_list.message:
Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [299743:300398]

Configurations:
- Updated for apparent renaming of CLANG_ANALYZER_MALLOC -> CLANG_ANALYZER_MEMORY_MANAGEMENT
- Updated for apparent renaming of CLANG_ANALYZER_OBJC_CFNUMBER -> CLANG_ANALYZER_NUMBER_OBJECT_CONVERSION.
- Updates to fix use of NSErrorDomain/NSErrorUserInfoKey/NS_ERROR_ENUM.
- Fix implicit conversion of NSNumber to BOOL.
- Update some targets to Swift 4.
- Nullability and type annotations.
- Layout fixes.

OmniFoundation:
- Fix OFXMLElement's block applier to work correctly on elements with a
  single child.
- Add more Swift wrappers for UTI conveniences.

OmniDataObjects:
- Invalidate computed properties during undo or redo, and suppress
  snapshot-based differences of those same properties. This leaves their values
  nil after an undo/redo change, and the next access will compute
  them correctly.

OmniSoftwareUpdate:
- Updated the OSUInstaller.sh script to specify the path to /usr/bin/id,
  and to ignore any errors from that command (which is just there to
  produce diagnostic output to help us determine why the script might be
  failing in other circumstances).
- When we find a news item is available, attempt to download it and cache
  the html before alerting the user.  When the user requests to see it,
  try first to load it directly from the web, which is the only way we can
  expect a good visual result.  If that fails, show the cached html, which will
  have no CSS and no images but will at least be something and the text should
  be readable.
  Clear the cache after the real page is successfully shown, or before running
  a new OSU check.

OmniAppKit:
- Update an assertion to only assert we have integral-sized images for resources
  from our bundle.

commit_list.message:
Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [288583:288882]

OmniBase:
- Remove cover macros for read(), write(), writev(), and close().

OmniFoundation:
- Convert getter/setters to properties.
- Explicitly declare an -init on OFRelativeDateFormatter that Swift wasn't seeing otherwise.
- Null-annotate OFRelativeDateFormatter.[hm].
- Add Collection extension for any(where:), all(where:), and subscript(safe:).
- Added -[OFXMLElement attributeCount].

OmniNetworking:
- Remove cover macros for read(), write(), writev(), and close().

OmniSoftwareUpdate:
- Fixed autolayout for system info explain-o-text.

OmniUI/iPad:
- MultiPaneController now overrides transitionCoordinator. Per the documentation, it prioritizes returning its superclass's coordinator, but if no such coordinator is available, it now vends a coordinator reflecting an active pane transition. This coordinator is tracked in MultiPanePresenter, much like the existing interactive transition was tracked, and exposed only within OmniUI. The coordinator's implementation exists on a new pair of extensions to MultiPaneNavigationTransitionContext, which already tracked most of the information required as part of its conformance to UIViewControllerContextTransitioning. The few additional bits required are mostly sets of callback blocks, which back calls to e.g. notifyWhenInteractionChanges(_:).
- If the view controller in a OUINavigationController wantsHiddenNavigationBar, hide the _accessoryAndBackgroundBar too.
- Guard against double-presenting a view controller that returns true from -isBeingPresented. Rewrite a couple guard statements on the call path to match our newly-decided Swift style.
- Add a flag on OUIAppController that says whether we can add a new document or not.

OmniUI/iPad-Document:
- Don't need to conform to ODSStoreDelegate twice; once is plenty.

Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [288882:289115]

OmniFoundation:
- Add OFUTIPreferredTagWithClass(), which avoids some oddiest in Swift bridging when trying to call UTTypeCopyPreferredTagWithClass.
- Use dispatch_once in +[OFBundleRegistry standardPath].
- Add an assertion in OFBundleRegistry to catch malformed bundles on iOS.
- Update the +standardPath method so that iOS will default to looking in the app wrapper.
- Declare NSUndoManager -isUndoingOrRedoing as a property.

OmniDataObjects:

OmniDAV:
- Splitting the XML-parsing and multistatus-parsing code out into their own functions.

OmniFileStore:
- Fix a bug where a mutable document key would return an invalid data representation sometimes.

OmniSoftwareUpdate:

OmniUI/iPad:
- Allow for no left pane in the multi-pane controller.
- Don't call +[OFBundleRegistry registerKnownBundles] manually. This is called on iOS via OBInvokeRegisteredLoadActions() now.
- Don't try to present an error atop the OUIDocumentPicker when it is hidden.

OmniUI/iPad-Document:
- Extract API from OUIDocumentExporter for getting the list of writable types for a given file item to a method in ODSFileItem(OUIDocumentExtensions).
- Avoid possible double-import of files from the Inbox.

OmniAppKit:
- Update project to reference specific framework targets.
- Null annotation pass on OAInternetConfig, and made passing a nil receiver work ("mailto:" opens a totally empty mail message, in Apple's Mail.app at least).

commit_list.message:
Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [274000:275000]

OmniBase:
- Don't flag expected deallocations as assertion failures; the backtrace where
  this occurs isn't interesting so there is no point stopping in the debugger.

OmniFoundation:
- Read and write the passphrase hint, and plumb it through to the prompt dialog
  and to the encryption settings object stored in the document model.
  Also fixed some unit-test rot.
- Made error info more informative for files whose TOC is inconsistent.
  Wrapped some code that can potentially generate large autoreleased NSDatas
  in an autorelease pool.
- Pulling some AEAD-mode unit tests out of the back of the closet.
- Fixed a bug in CBCMAC computation when buffers weren't aligned to AES block
  boundaries. This slightly changes the semantics of the OFAEAD functions to
  allow partial blocks (easier to deal with it there than at the call sites).
  Also added a test which exposes the bug.
- The version of CCSymmetricKeyUnwrap() that ships with iOS 10.2 beta and
  macOS 10.12.2 beta has changed its error return slightly. It previously
  returned -1 for most (all?) errors, but now returns kCCParamError.
  This causes us trouble when attempting to differentiate between an error
  caused by a genuine bad parameter and one caused by an unwrapping failure.

  To work around this, introduce a wrapper function OFSymmetricKeyUnwrap()
  that calls CCSymmetricKeyUnwrap() and does some error rewriting.

  OFCryptoTest now also tests OFSymmetricKeyUnwrap() in addition to the
  existing CCSymmetricKeyUnwrap() checks (and gets a little reorganization
  along the way).

OmniSoftwareUpdate:
- Add late 2016 MacBook Pros to the OSUDevices list
- Move registration of a few defaults to the OmniSoftwareUpdates.defaults file.

OmniUnzip:
- Fixed a crash which occurred when we encountered a failure to open a zip
  archive.
- The streaming decompression support in OUUnzipArchive broke in the situation
  where the archive does not exist on the local disk. Fixed that and made the
  internal API clearer that it's a possibility.
- The only use of the path argument for an archive backed by a byte provider was
  for generating error messages. The display name for error messages now has its
  own instance variable.
- The external API, for the handful of places we create an OUUnzipArchive from
  a data blob, now explicitly separates the "description:" parameter from the
  "path:" parameter and fails if you try to supply both a path and a byte provider.

OmniUI/iPad-Document:
- Add an activity indicator to the document picker and make it spin when
 deleting documents.

OmniAppKit:
- Don't ask a color for its .colorSpace until we've tested that it
  doesn't belong to the named or pattern color space (which we test for
  by name).
- Support for showing hint text when prompting for a passphrase.
- Add a notion of 'auxiliary' window controllers to OADocument via a category
  on NSWindowController (defaulting to NO / non-auxiliary).
commit_list.repo_description: Source for many of The Omni Group's frameworks

commit_list.message:
Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [273500:274000]

Configurations:
- Don't codesign watchOS frameworks when building; they get codesigned
  when copied into the app.

OmniBase:
- Add Swift wrapper for OBExpectedDeallocation.
- Make OBLogger more swift-friendly.

OmniFoundation:
- Avoid crash if OFMultipleOptionErrorRecovery is called with out-of-bounds recoveryOptionIndex.

OmniDataObjects:
- Fixed a latent bug in _updateResultSetForChanges in
  ODOEditingContext-Internal.m, where any updated objects are excluded from
  the fetch if the fetch has a nil predicate.

OmniFileExchange:
- Added "Library" to our OFXDangerousSierraFolders list.
- Renamed an `error` local variable to be more specific about where it was being used.
- Add another NSError local for another use (cleaning up a temporary file) to
  avoid clobbering the real error before returning. Only log the second error
  if it was something other than the file we were trying to remove not existing.

OmniFileStore:
- OmniFileStore's Errors.[hm] defines a fixed range of encryption errors,
  with accompanying -[NSError(OFSExtensions) causedByEncryptionFailure]

OmniUI/iPad:
- Refactored OUIInspector to a delegation architecture.
- Removed -[OUIInspector updateInspectorWithTraitCollection:].
- The inspector’s navigationController is now wrapped inside of an
  OUIWrappingViewController before being put into the MultiPaneController.

OmniInspector:
- Clean up interaction between OIStackedSlicesInspector and OITabbedInspector
- Deleted OISectionedInspector. Removed *TabbedInspector's reliance on its view
  to call it back and tell it when it's getting put in a window.
commit_list.repo_description: Source for many of The Omni Group's frameworks

commit_list.message:
Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [273000:273500]

OmniFoundation:
- Make the CMSRecipient protocol @objc and public, as well as the
  CMSRecipientType enumeration.
- Split the encryption settings inspection accessors into a separate file.
- Fixed some edge cases in document/keychain identifier storage and
  recipient resolution.
- Converting the RunningActivityCount debug counter to use stdatomic
  instead of the now-deprecated OSAtomic.

OmniUI/iPad:
- Removed all -inspectObject:viewController:… API. This API conflated the
  inspection of objects with presenting the inspector navigation controller.
  We now want to separate these two actions. Marked removed API as OBDEPRECATED_METHOD()
- OUIPasswordAlert doesn't actually have any use for the NSURLProtectionSpace,
  except as a fallback if the supplied title is nil. Make the designated
  initializer not take a protection space, and add a convenience to provide
  the old behavior.

OmniUI/iPad-Document:
- Fix a bug where if we had an error generating result data, we'd call the
  completion handler twice.
- Minimal encryption support for iOS: you can open/edit a password-protected
  encrypted document, but there's no UI for encrypting or inspecting the
  encryption settings.

OmniAppKit:
- Add OAViewStackConstraints, a non-view-hierarchy class that maintains the
  constraints between a set of views, some of which may be hidden, so that
  they stay arranged in a (vertical or horizontal) stack between two
  other anchors.
- Utillities for user interaction with PKC identities:
  - OASecCertificateProxy - wraps a SecCertificateRef and caches/computes
    display attributes
  - OUIChooseCertificate - a simple certificate chooser panel
- OAToolbarWindowController now posts a notification when the toolbar
  configuration changes.
- OACompositeColors() explicitly takes (and returns) nil to indicate a
  clear color.

OmniInspector:
- Remove OmniInspector’s extension on OAToolbarWindowController
commit_list.repo_description: Source for many of The Omni Group's frameworks

commit_list.message:
Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [272500:273000]

General:
- Switched to using sRGB for our default color space, rather than the
  legacy "generic" RGB color space.

Configurations:
- Accepted some of the recommended changes from Xcode 8.1 (beta 3)
  - We no longer codesign frameworks when building them since they get signed
    when copied into their wrapper app.
  - Renamed EMBEDDED_CONTENT_CONTAINS_SWIFT to ALWAYS_EMBED_SWIFT_STANDARD_LIBRARIES.
  - Enabled ONLY_ACTIVE_ARCH ... we typically only build for a single arch per
    platform now anyway (though maybe not on iOS?). Anyway, faster builds
    are good and OAB will catch bad casts.
- Turn on CLANG_ANALYZER_NONNULL=YES. Xcode 8.1 seems to have gotten rid of the
  false positives (or vast majority of them).

Scripts:
- Added Omni.read_only_command, which will run a shell command even when
  Omni.do_nothing? is set.

OmniBase:
- Added OBMissedDeallocationObserver, and OBMemoryUseHistory allowing
  visualization of missing deallocations.

OmniFoundation:
- Make OFBundleRegistryTarget a formal protocol.
- Minor casting/final/nullability cleanup.
- Add OFDiagnostics.

OmniDataObjects:
- Added an assertion to catch the case where an instance class implements a
  setter for the readonly/calculated side of a relationship.

OmniAppKit:
- Workaround for rdar://problem/28832571, Sierra: Custom toolbar changes crashes
  if you have multiple tabs

OmniInspector:
- Add support for enabling only certain inspector tabs.
commit_list.repo_description: Source for many of The Omni Group's frameworks

commit_list.message:
Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [272000:272500]

OmniFoundation:
- Added some flexibility to the AlgorithmIdentifier and OCTET STRING parsers.
- Added a format specifier 'a' for NSArray<NSData> to OFASN1MakeStructure().
- Finished up the format for file packages. This should give us the flexibility
  to do things like take advantage of NSFileWrapper's hardlink-on-save in the
  future if we decide we need to. Assigned a real namespace identifier.
- Fixed a couple of bugs in CMS generation/reading.
- Polymorphism annotations
- Additional string identifiers.
- Add more assertion failures to ignore in the save panel.

OmniDataObjects:
- Updated/added nullability annotations.
- Added nullability annotations to the generated model code.
- To-many relationships are now declared as generic sets.
- To-one relationships are declared as read-only in every abstract class of
  a class hierarchy (with a __kindof modifier, which we may remove if it
  proves not to be helpful) and declared as readwrite on the leaf/concrete
  class.
- ODODynamicSetValueForProperty now enforces that the value set for a to-one
  relationship is of the write class/entity at set time.

OmniFileExchange:
- When testing against a folder in the user's home folder, make
  sure the entire folder name matches rather than just looking
  for a prefix match.
- Made the list of dangerous locations configurable.

OmniUnzip:
- Update nullability annotations

OmniAppKit:
- Added new methods to NSDocument to get a filtered subset of the window controllers:
  - (NSArray <__kindof NSWindowController *> *)windowControllersOfClass:(Class)windowControllerClass;
  - (NSArray <__kindof NSWindowController *> *)orderedWindowControllersOfClass:(Class)windowControllerClass;
  - (__kindof NSWindowController *)frontWindowControllerOfClass:(Class)windowControllerClass;
- Keep track of whether the last find operation was successful. If it wasn't,
  don't try to do the "Replace" part of "Find and Replace" (just do a Find Next).
  If we get into Replace w/o the previous Find being successful, we now beep.

OmniInspector:
- Don't assume we have any tab identifiers when creating a
  OITabbedInspector instance.
- Default to allow pinning.
commit_list.repo_description: Source for many of The Omni Group's frameworks

commit_list.message:
Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [271500:272000]

OmniFoundation:
- Add support for specifying a schema in generated XML.
- Extended -[NSBundle(OFExtensions) codeSigningEntitlements:] to support iOS.

OmniDataObjects:
- Added -[ODODatabase fetchCommittedAttributes:fromEntity:matchingPredicate:error:].

OmniFileExchange:
- Changed the descriptions of the "local folder unusable" errors to more
  clearly indicate the required action ("Please choose another
  location...") and the explicit reason for requiring that action
  (specifically calling out the Desktop or Documents folder as
  appropriate). Also switched to phrasing that works whether you're in
  seeing the message while in the process of choosing a new location
  (the only way this used to be able to happen) or when sync fails
  because we're requiring you to choose a new location.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

OmniAppKit:

commit_list.message:
Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [271228:271500]

OmniFoundation:
  - Added a Swift extension on NSLocking, protect(), which runs a block with the lock taken and returns the result of the block.
  - Made OFMultiValueDictionary a subclass of NSObject rather than OFObject, so that creating one won't provoke OBPostLoader.

OmniFileStore:
  - Pass a display name down into OFSDocumentKey(KeychainStorageSupport) when storing the encryption key, and make sure to persist it in the Mac entry's kSecAttrLabel.

OmniAppKit:
  - Switch from block-based NSNotification handler to selector-based for updating tint images.
  - Improved tabbed window support when running on macOS Sierra.
  - Disable screen updates around performing the block for creating a new tab, which seems to eliminate the flash and make the window stack operation atomic.
  - Fixed a regression where -frontWindowController used windowControllers instead of orderedWindowControllers.

Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [290414:291038]

General:
- More nullability annotations.

OmniFoundation:
- Marked -[OFBinding initWithObject:keyPath:] as the designated initializer,
 and marked -init as unavailable (especially) so that clients don't
 inadvertently create instances with the inherited empty initializer,
 which is incorrect.

OmniDAV:

OmniSoftwareUpdate:
- When calculating the storage size, we used to loop through all mounted
  partitions using getmntinfo(3), but apfs returns the disk total for multiple
  partitions so that was returning an incorrect total. Perhaps what we really
  want is to look at the size of the filesystem our app's sandbox lives in,
  but for now let's just grab the size of the root filesystem.

OmniUI/iPad:

  controller rather than hiding it.

commit_list.message:
Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [289908:290414]

OmniFoundation:
- OFFilterProcess now clears DYLD_INSERT_LIBRARIES.
- OFRelativeDateFormatter no longer rejectings -dateFromString:.
- Moved -convertToAppleEventDescriptor: from OmniFocus into
  OmniFoundation, and fixed a few things along the way.

OmniDataObjects:
- Fix an #import so it can find its reference on a case-sensitive file
  system.

OmniSoftwareUpdate:
- Update OSUDevices.json with new iPad Pro models
- Add WWDC 2017 Mac models

OmniDocumentStore:
- For a move operation _doMotion's completion handler needs to know where the
  file items we moved ended up. For copy it wants the ODSFileItems created at
  the destination. The problem here was the completion handler thought we had
  failed to create a folder so it didn't get to the part of the completion that
  ended the progress indicator. In that error path, added a call to
  activityIndicator stopAnimating.

OmniUI/iPad:
- -[UIApplication delegate] triggers the main-thread checker in Xcode 9.
  Cache the result with a dispatch_once and rely on this getting hit on the
  main thread before we call it on a background queue.
- Made selected tab text color and tab border colors themeable.
- -[OUIStackedSlicesInspectorPane viewWillAppear:] calls -notifyChildrenThatAppearanceDidChange
  at the end if OUIInspectorAppearance is enabled.
- Don't reload the inspectors if they are not in the view hierarchy, but also
  make sure they are visible on the screen, as hidden embedded inspectors are
  in the view hierarchy but not on screen.
- OUIStackedSlicesInspector's OUIStackedSlicesInspectorPaneContentView used to
  be initialized with height self.inspector.mainPane.preferredContentSize.height.
  Since it uses autolayout to size itself to the stack view it contains that
  has been removed.

OmniUI/iPad-Document:
- Updated the empty overlay view text color. Each app can now specify this color
  via an -[OUIDocumentAppController emptyOverlayViewTextColor] override.
  The default is _window.tintColor.
  OUIDocumentPickerViewController and OUIDocumentCreationTemplatePickerViewController
  have been updated to use the long form constructor for building OUIEmptyOverlayViews
  that includes passing the text color. It consults -[OUIDocumentAppController emptyOverlayViewTextColor]
  for the text color.
- In -closeAndDismissDocumentWithCompletionHandler:, if we are closing and
  dismissing the document, but the document picker has no presented view
  controller, just call the completion handler as the document has already
  been closed.

OmniInspector:
- Fix build issues with Xcode 9.
- Added tooltips for any labels that get truncated.

Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [291810:292307]

General:
- Switch to Xcode 9.0 b3 for macOS and iOS builds
- Enable several warnings suggested by Xcode 9 and fix fallout

- More tweaks for themeing.

commit_list.message:
Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [289510:289908]

OmniFoundation:
- Unify some assertion checking for infoDictionary.
- Pass the finishing operation as an argument to OFAsynchronousOperation's pre-completion block.
- Add OFVersionNumber +isOperatingSystemHighSierraOrLater.
- Add OFSelectionSet -applyInInsertionOrder:

OmniDataObjects:
- Added -will/didNullifyRelationship: to OODObject. Subclasses can use this to
  invalidate caches based on those relationships.
- Added +shouldIncludeSnapshotForTransientCalculatedProperty: to ODOObject.
  Subclasses can opt out of including values in the snapshot. If the value
  contains an ODOObject, it *must* opt out, because after delete and
  re-insertion you'll have a pointer to the previously inserted object, not
  the re-inserted one.
- Changed -will/didNullifyRelationship: to accept a set of relationships, and
  sent it once at the beginning/end of the nullification loop.

OmniDAV:
- If a DAV operation fails after some number of redirects, store those redirects in the error we generate, so that the calling code can determine where the error actually happened.

OmniFileStore:
- New method -[OFSDocumentKey borrowUnwrappingFrom:otherKey].
  This allows you to unwrap a document key given another,
  already-unwrapped, document key that used the same passphrase and
  parameters. This is useful if, for example, another client has updated
  the key table without changing the password, and we want to get the
  up-to-date key table without going through the whole password
  retrieval and key-derivation rigamarole.

OmniSoftwareUpdate:
- Include "OSUHardwareInfo.h" instead of <OmniSoftwareUpdate/OSUHardwareInfo.h>.
  Otherwise, when we are building the OSUCheckService XPC service which gets
  embedded in the framework, Xcode 9 will infer a dependency on the framework,
  making the graph cyclical.

OmniUI/iPad:
- Added theming to OUIInstructionTextInspectorSlice.
- Properties to support OUIInspectorAppearance theming for OUISliceSeparatorView.
- Apply themeing in -[OUITheemedTableViewCell prepareForReuse] and then don't defeat it in cellForRowAtIndexPath:

commit_list.message:
Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [292307:292812]

Configurations:
- Bump the time for -warn-long-function-bodies from 100ms to 125ms. There are a
  lot of trivial functions that just barely miss 100ms, so let's concentrate on
  the more complicated stuff if we are going to fix something first.

Tools/SVNVersion:
- List the output SVNVersion.h file for each of the per-platform shell script
  build phases.

OmniBase:
- On iOS, adding a block observer for NSBundleDidLoadNotification causes
  a hang in CoreAnimation when initializing a UIWebView (predictably) or
  even when just rotating the screen (and taking a snapshot of the
  existing views).

  We don't need this notification on iOS (where we don't load bundles
  dynamically anyway and where we'd never even ported OBPostLoader
  functionality in the past), so I'm disabling the observation code
  there.

OmniFoundation:
- Add OFUTIDescription.
- Modernize some code in OFCompletionMatch.
- Fixed undefined behavior noticed by UBSan.

OmniDataObjects:
- Added convenience extensions on ODOEditingContext to allow fetching of an
  object by objectID or primaryKey/entityName pair that infers the type from
  the calling context to avoid casting at the call site.

OmniUI/iPad:
- More themeing work in inspectors.
- Add support for displaying different content in a view controller when a
  feature is disabled.
- OUIPasswordAlert no longer drops its provided protection space on the floor.
- Reworked hideSidebar(atLocation:) so that it does the correct thing for both
  overlaid and embedded sidebars.
- Handle all of our special scheme URLs being loaded by the web view,
  not just those triggered by a "link activated" navigation.

OWF:
- Fixed a crash due to sending a message to an OFWeakReference that was
  meant to go to the object it holds.

OmniAppKit:
- When computing a composite color, if the top most color is opaque just use it.
- When converting a color to a destination color space, if the color is already
  in that color space, just use it.

commit_list.message:
Updated with changes from OmniGroup svn [292812:295006]

General:
- Nullability and type updates for Swift bridging.
- Beginnings of updates for Files integration in iOS 11.
- Add bug:// links for OBFinishPorting* instances.
- Localization updates.

Configurations:
- Bump watchOS requirement to 4.0
- Restored -DNON_OMNI_BUILD_ENVIRONMENT.

OmniBase:
- Avoid 'unsafe' use of strcpy(), which is actually safe, but this avoids
  triggering a compiler warning and may be marginally faster.

OmniFoundation:
- Added plist serialization for OFIndexPath.

OmniUI/iPad:
- OUIMenuOption's action block now gets passed the menu option instance.
- Move some images into xcassets.
- Add disclosable inspector slices.
- Move the email-debug-info command to the OUIDebugURLCommand class.
- Interface updates for iOS 11.

OmniUI/iPad-Document:
- New shared images to better fit iOS 11.
- In OUIServerAccountValidationViewController, grab the challenge from the
  error that has it, rather from the one on the top of the stack.
- Added support for dragging documents from our document browser.
  Supports adding more than one document to a drag session.

OmniAppKit:
- OAWebPageViewer sets `wantsLayer` on the WebDocumentView to avoid some issues
  in Yosemite (which may or many not have been resolved). If the content is
  long enough, though, this can exceed the allowed size for a layer on a
  Retina MBP. Add a read-only webViewShouldUseLayer property on OAWebPageViewer
  to allow subclasses to turn off layer backing.
